intro: Cyperus melanospermus, commonly known as blackseed sedge, is a perennial herb native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the sedge family (Cyperaceae) and is characterized by its triangular stems and dense, grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its seeds are dark and hard, often used in traditional medicine and as a spice in some cuisines. Cyperus melanospermus thrives in wetland habitats and is often found in marshy areas or along water bodies.
